intro: Antillanthus saugetii, commonly known as the Cuban antillanthus, is a rare flowering plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in its native range.
